DataElement.preferredName: Patient Other Disease or Disorder Clinical Study Consent Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to patient consent in regards to other disease study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Other Disease or Disorder Clinical Study Consent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to patient consent in regards to other disease study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Other Diseases and Disorders Clinical Study Consent
Property.preferredDefinition: Not otherwise specified.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Your blood and tissue samples
ReferenceDocuments.description: Your blood and tissue samples may be used for research about other health problems (for example: causes of heart disease, osteoporosis, diabetes)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimens may be kept for use in research about other health problems

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description:
Patient's initial consent given for specimen(s) may be kept for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat other health problems (for example:
diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Your tissue and blood samples may be used for research about other diseases

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: My specimens may be kept for use in research about other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease).

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient consent to keeping samples and related information in a biobank for use in future research in diseases other than cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient consent to extra and leftover samples that may be banked and used for research about other health problems?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient agreed to the use of specimen samples to do research about medical questions other than cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree for leftover bone marrow and/or blood to be banked for future use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree for leftover blood to be banked for future use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree for leftover blood and tissue to be kept (banked) for future use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient agree for leftover blood to be kept (banked) for future use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example:  diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: DCP Question Text - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: My samples and related information may be kept in a Biobank for use in research related to other diseases such as diabetes, Alzheimer's disease or heart disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient agree to have eight (8) blood samples collected and used for the purposes described in the consent form?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree for blood samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree for bone marrow samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient agree for samples to be kept (banked) for use in research to learn about, prevent, or treat cancer or other health problems (for example: diabetes, Alzheimer's disease, or heart disease)?

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Patient Consent Ind-2 2018303v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
